Strongly interactive 0D/2D hetero-structure of ZnxCd1-xS nanoparticle decorated phosphorene nano-sheet for enhanced visiblelight photocatalytic H2 production Jingrun Rana, Xiuli Wangb, Bicheng Zhuc and Shi-Zhang Qiao*a
A novel zero-dimensional (0D)/two-dimensional (2D) heterojunction of ZnxCd1-xS nano-particle loaded phosphorene nano-sheet was assembled to achieve highly-efficient visible-light photocatalytic H2 production. Further mechanistic insight into the high performance and strong interaction in this nano-comoposite provides guidance to design numerous 0D/2D hetero-structures towards various applications in catalysis, electronic and optoelectronic.
The generation of chemical fuels using solar energy is deemed as one of the main strategies to address the global energy and environmental problems. In the past decades, tremendous efforts have been contributed to achieve high-performance solar-to-hydrogen (H2) conversion, ever since the initial report by Fujishima and Honda on photoelectrochemical water splitting on a titania electrode in 1972.[1] Photocatalytic water splitting is a promising, low-cost and environmental-friendly approach for solar H2 production.[2-8] Unfortunately, the current solar-to-H2 conversion efficiency and robustness of this technique is far too low for practical applications.[2-4] Recently, hetero-structured photocatalysts have demonstrated huge success in achieving outstanding activity and stability for photocatalytic H2 production, via combining different nanobuilding blocks altogether by forming intimate electronic coupling.[9-20]
For decades, zero-dimensional (0D) semiconductor nanoparticles (NPs) have attracted tremendous attention owing to their unique features, e.g. small size, large surface area, short charge-migration distance,[21,22] rendering them highly-
promising in utilizing the photo-induced charges in photocatalysis field. Unfortunately, several shortcomings still impedes their realistic applications:[21,23,24] i) tendency to selfaggregation, greatly decreasing their exposed surface area and active sites; ii) instability compared to their bulk counterparts, owing to their massive surface defects; iii) easy recombination of photo-induced electron-hole pairs, resulting in low chargeutilizing efficiency.[25] One of the most effective solutions to these problems lies in the deposition of 0D NP on the ultrathin two-dimensional (2D) nano-sheet (NS) to yield 0D/2D heteostructures.[26,27] The strong electronic coupling between the two components not only lead to the high dispersion and improved stability of 0D NPs, but also greatly boost their charge separation and transfer efficiency. As a result, tremendously enhanced photocatalytic performance is realized in the 0D/2D nano-composites.[28,29]
With excellent and tunable absorption in the visible-light region of solar spectrum, ZnxCd1-xS (ZCS) solid solutions are considered as a promising photocatalyst candidate.[13,15,30] Among different ZCS nano-structures developed, 0D ZCS NPs have demonstrated great potential in achieving highperformance photocatalytic H2 production, due to its distinguished properties of large surface area and short chargediffusion length.[15,30] However, in these cases, transitionalmetal based co-catalysts, e.g. Pt, are still required to enhance the photo-induced electron-hole utilization efficiency.[15] On the other hand, phosphorene, a single layer of black phosphorous (BP), has recently emerged as a promising metal-free 2D material, due to its high charge mobility at room temperature, flexible band gap varying from 0.3 to 2 eV and large surface area.[31-39] Meanwhile, as one of the most widespread elements, phosphorous possesses ca. 100 billion tons of reserves on the earth.[40] Thus, the loading of 0D ZCS NP on the surface of ultrathin 2D phosphorene NS to form a novel 0D/2D heterostructure is anticipated to achieve significantly enhanced activity and stability in photocatalysis, even without any metalbased co-catalysts. Herein, the 0D/2D ZCS/phosphorene nano-composite was for the first time systematically studied to untangle its physicochemical properties, photocatalytic performance and mechanism. The optimized ZCS/phosphorene nano-composite exhibited an excellent photocatalytic H2-production activity of 9326 µmol h-1 g-1, with an apparent QE of 21.5% at 420 nm. Both the theoretical calculations and advanced characterizations (e.g. synchrotron-based near edge X-ray absorption fine structure, NEXAFS, and transient-state photoluminescence spectra) corroborate that the strong electronic interactions in this composite not only make the 0D ZCS NPs more dispersive and robust, but also greatly suppress their charge recombination, thus leading to the remarkably improved photocatalytic performance. Firstly, the 0D ZCS NPs were fabricated by a hydrothermal method.[30] Then 2D few-layer phosphorene (FLP, 5-6 nm, 6-8 layers) were acquired through exfoliating the bulk BP by ultrasonication and high-speed centrifugation, as confirmed by the atomic-force microscopy (AFM) results (Fig. S1a and b, ESI†), transmission electron microscopy (TEM) image (Fig. S2a, ESI†), high-resolution (HR)TEM image (Fig. S2b, ESI†), Raman spectra (Fig. S3a, ESI†) and high-resolution X-ray photoelectron spectra (XPS) of P 2p for FLP (Fig. S3b, ESI†). Finally, 0D/2D ZCS NP loaded FLP NS was synthesized by a facile physical-mixing technique. The nominal weight ratios of FLP to ZCS were R = 0, 0.5, 2.0, 6.0 and 9.0 wt%, and the resulting samples were denoted as P0, P0.5, P2, P6 and P9, respectively. The formation of 0D/2D hetero-structure in P2 was confirmed by TEM, HRTEM, energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDX) and X-ray diffraction (XRD) techniques. Compared to the selfaggregated ZCS NPs observed in P0 (Fig. S4, ESI†), ZCS NPs with sizes of ca. 15-60 nm were uniformly dispersed on the surface of 2D FLP NS in P2 (Fig. 1a). Two lattice fringe values of 0.25 and 0.32 nm were observed in P2 (Fig. 1b), corresponding to the (040) plane of BP[37] and (002) plane of ZCS, respectively. Moreover, Zn, Cd, S and P elements were found in the EDX pattern of P2 (Fig. 1c), in agreement with the above TEM and HRTEM results. The hexagonal wurtzite-structured phase of ZnS (JCPDS No. 77-2306) was observed for both P0 and P2 (Fig. 1d). However, the absence of BP phase in P2 (Fig. 1d and S5, ESI†) was due to the high dispersion and low content of FLP. All these results support the construction of a novel 0D/2D ZCS/FLP hetero-junction in P2.
The microstructure of P2 was further studied by N2 sorption analysis. The loading of ZCS NP onto the surface of FLP NS might lead to the covering of the exposed surface active sites on ZCS NP, thus leading to the decreased surface area of P2 (42.1 m2 g1) compared with that of P0 (48.6 m2 g-1), as confirmed in Table S1 (see ESI†) and Fig. 1e. This result also confirms the intimate contact between 0D ZCS NP and 2D FLP NS. The optical property of this 0D/2D hetero-structure was investigated by UV-Vis diffuse reflectance spectra. Both P0 and P2 possess almost the same absorption edge at 520 nm (Eg = 2.4 eV, Fig. 1f), suggesting that the loading of ZCS onto FLP imposes no influence on the band gap of ZCS.
Fig. 1 (a) A typical TEM image, (b) HRTEM image, and (c) EDX spectrum of P2; (d) XRD patterns of P0 and P2; (e) N2 sorption isotherms of P0 and P2. The inset shows the pore size distribution curves of P0 and P2; (f) UV-Vis diffuse reflectance spectra of P0, P0.5, P2, P6 and P9. The inset shows the colours of P0, P0.5, P2, P6 and P9.
Another outstanding characteristic of this 0D/2D heterostructure lies in its significantly improved charge separation and transfer efficiency, promoted by the 2D NS with high charge mobility and large surface area. To confirm this viewpoint, a series of characterizations, including transient photocurrent density (TPC) measurement, steady- and transient-state photoluminescence (PL) spectra, were conducted. The enhanced TPC density of P2 compared to that of P0 (Fig. S6, ESI†) suggest the increased electron-hole separation efficiency. The quenched steady-state PL peak of P2 (Fig. S7, ESI†), compared to that of P0, also indicates the repressed recombination of electron-hole pairs in P2. Furthermore, the transient-state PL spectra were also conducted to reveal the charge-carrier lifetime of the P0 and P2. The short (τ1) and middle (τ2) charge-carrier lifetime of P2 are elongated compared to those of P0 (Fig. 2a), suggesting the loading of 0D ZCS NP on 2D FLP NS can effectively promote the interfacial charge separation and migration. All these results corroborate the excellent electron-hole separation and transport efficiency in 0D/2D ZCS/FLP (P2). This is because the photo-induced charge carriers generated in 0D ZCS NPs can promptly transfer to 2D FLP with high charge mobility and large surface area, thanks to the unique 0D/2D hetero-structure.
The high charge utilization efficiency in the 0D/2D heterostructure of P2 drives us to further study the interactions between the two moieties, by both state-of-art characterizations and theoretical calculations. The strong electronic interactions between 0D ZCS NP and 2D FLP NS were further revealed by high-resolution XPS and NEXAFS approaches. As displayed in Fig. 2b, two peaks located at 129.3 and 130.0 eV are assigned to the P 2p3/2 and P 2p1/2 peaks of elemental P0.[38] P 2p peaks located around 133.0 eV are ascribed to the P 2p peaks of oxidized PxOy.[38] Compared to the P 2p peaks of FLP (Fig. S3b, ESI†), the shift of P 2p peaks for P2 towards the low binding energy direction corroborates the

Moreover, the NEXAFS P K edge for P2 (Fig. 2c) shows a shift of 1.6 eV towards the low photon energy direction, compared to that of FLP, again confirming the electron transfer from ZCS to FLP after their coupling. On the other hand, the high-resolution Zn 2p, Cd 3d and S 2p peaks of P2 (Fig. S8a, b and c, ESI†) exhibit no obvious shift, in comparison to those of P0. This is due to the much larger mass content (98.0 wt%) of ZCS than that of FLP (2.0 wt%) in P2. Nevertheless, the highly-sensitive NEXAFS of Zn L edge and S L edge for P2 exhibits shift towards the high photon energy direction (Fig. S9a and b, ESI†), compared to those of P0, also implying the electron migration from ZCS to FLP. This phenomenon is further supported by the larger work function of FLP (4.92 eV) compared to that of ZCS (4.02 eV), as revealed by their UPS spectra (Fig. S10a and S11a, ESI†). On the other hand, the calculations results also exhibit that phosphorene possesses larger work function (4.89 eV) than ZCS (4.52 eV). Besides, the differential charge density map of phosphorene/ZCS also indicates the transfer of electron from ZCS to phosphorene, with a Mulliken charge transfer of 0.3 e. Hence, the theoretical calculations are in accordance with the above experimental results.
Considering the excellent properties of this 0D/2D ZCS/FLP hetero-structure, the corresponding photocatalytic H2production activities were tested. As displayed in Fig. 3a, a low activity of 484 µmol h-1 g-1 was observed on bare ZCS (R = 0), mainly ascribed to its fast recombination of photo-induced electron/hole pairs. Interestingly, combining 0.5 wt% FLP with ZCS induced an obviously enhanced activity of 1476 µmol h-1 g-1 on P0.5 (R = 0.5). An optimized activity of 9326 µmol h-1 g-1 was attained on 2.0 wt% FLP coupled ZCS (R = 2). Meanwhile, an apparent QE of 21.5% was also observed on P2, rendering it an efficient binary 0D/2D ZCS-based photocatalysts, in the absence of any metal-based co-catalyst.[30] Besides, P2 even shows higher photocatalytic activity than 2.0 wt% Pt loaded ZCS
Fig. 3 (a) A comparison of the photocatalytic H2-production activities of P0, P0.5, P2, P6, P9, FLP and 2Pt-ZCS in the presence of 18 vol% lactic acid as the sacrificial reagent under visible-light irradiation (λ > 420 nm, 300 W Xenon light); (b) Illustration of photocatalytic H2-production mechanism for 0D/2D ZCS/FLP composite system under visible-light irradiation.
(2Pt-ZCS, 8021 µmol h-1 g-1) under the identical conditions. This result stresses that the metal-free FLP NS could function as a powerful 2D platform to replace expensive and rare noblemetal Pt. But further increasing FLP content deteriorated the activity, resulting in its drop to 2373 µmol h-1 g-1 and 924 µmol h-1 g-1 for P6 and P9, respectively. The decreased performance results from the blocked active sites and shielded light harvesting by the redundant FLP. Furthermore, the optimized P2 sample also exhibited good photocatalytic stability, since P2 still retained 84.7% of its original activity after 20-hour reaction (Fig. S12, ESI†). After analyzing the TEM image of the reacted P2 (P2-R, Fig. S13a, ESI†), we found no apparent alteration of the morphology of P2-R compared to those of P2, suggesting the robustness of the sample. In addition, compared to the P 2p peaks of P2, the P 2p peaks of P2-R (Fig. S13b, ESI†) exhibit increased oxidation due to the presence of water and residue O2 in the reactor.
Based on the above experimental results, a photocatalytic mechanism of 0D/2D ZCS/FLP hetero-structure is proposed in Fig. 3b. The conduction band (CB) and valence band (VB) edge positions of both ZCS and FLP were firstly determined by combining UPS spectra (Fig. S10a, S10b, S11a and S11b, ESI†) and UV-Vis absorbance spectra (Fig. 1f and S14, ESI†), which are shown in Fig. 3b. The deposition of 0D ZCS NP on the surface of 2D FLP results in strong electronic coupling between them. After their combination, the electrons would migrate from ZCS to FLP due to the higher Fermi level (EF) position (-0.42 V vs. standard hydrogen electrode, SHE) of ZCS than that of FLP (0.48 V vs. SHE). Moreover, the CB edge position of ZCS (-0.88 V vs. SHE) is more negative than that of FLP (-0.40 V vs. SHE), whilst the VB edge position of ZCS (1.52 V vs. SHE) is more negative than that of FLP (1.69 V vs. SHE). Thus, ZCS and FLP form a typical type II hetero-junction, which greatly promotes the separation and transfer of photo-induced electrons and holes. In detail, under visible-light irradiation (λ > 420 nm), the photoinduced electrons would transfer from the ZCS NPs to the underlying 2D FLP while the photo-induced holes would remain in ZCS NPs. Afterwards, due to the excellent charge mobility of FLP, these photo-induced electrons would promptly migrate to the massive active sites on the surface of FLP, where the photoinduced electrons would reduce protons to form H2. sacrificial reagent, lactic acid. In summary, we for the first time systematically studied the novel 0D/2D ZCS/FLP hetero-structure for visible-light photocatalytic H2 production. With an optimal FLP content of 2.0 wt%, the ZCS/FLP nano-composite exhibits the highest visible-light photocatalytic H2-production activity of 9326 µmol h-1 g-1 and an excellent apparent QE of 21.5% at 420 nm. Such a high activity is attributed to the unique 0D/2D hetero-structures formed between ZCS NP and FLP NS, which induces strong electronic coupling, enhanced charge utilization efficiency and extended active centers. This work not only demonstrates that the emerging phosphorene can serve as an excellent 2D platform to prepare a large number of 0D/2D hetero-structured photocatalysts, but also provides insightful understanding of this particular hetero-structure for its applications in different fields. This work was financially supported by Australian Research Council through the Discovery Project programs (DP140104062, DP160104866, DP170104464). NEXAFS measurements were undertaken on the soft X-ray beamline at the Australian Synchrotron.
